definition: king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])

sentences.english: It is a major characteristics of wang wei's poems that they are imbued with pastoral beauty.
sentences.chinese: “诗中有画”是王维诗歌创作的一大特色。

sentences.english: Wangwei was a famous pastoral poet of landscape.
sentences.chinese: 王维是盛唐时期著名的山水田园诗人。

sentences.english: Apart from the landscape style poems, Wang Wei is also remarkable in the composition of frontier fortress poems.
sentences.chinese: 王维除山水诗外，边塞诗也写得很出色。

sentences.english: Did Wang Wei just concern himself with the blossom of plums?
sentences.chinese: 王维所思念的岂只是寒梅开花与否？

sentences.english: In this letter Wang Wei revealed great affections to his friend .
sentences.chinese: 由此问句，透露出王维对友人浓浓的思念之情。

sentences.english: Part Two concentrates on studying painting-in-poetry of Wangwei.
sentences.chinese: 下编则是集中对王维“诗中有画”艺术进行研究。

sentences.english: Snow and River, by Wang Wei(reputedly).
This article compares and analyses the similarities and differences of Wang Wei and Li Bai's Idylls.
sentences.chinese: 本文对王维和李白的山水田园诗的异同作了比较分析。

definition: Du Fu (712-770), great Tang dynasty poet

Su Shi (1037-1101), also known as Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡[Su1 Dong1 po1] northern Song Dynasty writer and calligrapher/one of the Three Su father and sons 三蘇|三苏[San1 Su1] and one of the Eight Giants of Tang and Song Prose 唐宋八大家[Tang2 Song4 Ba1 Da4 jia1]
Liu Zongyuan (773-819), Tang essayist and poet, advocate of the classical writing 古文運動|古文运动 and neoclassical 復古|复古 movements
Lu Zhaolin (637-689), one of the Four Great Poets of the Early Tang 初唐四傑|初唐四杰[Chu1 Tang2 Si4 jie2]
Tao Yuanming (c. 365-427), Jin dynasty writer and poet
Han Yu (768-824), Tang dynasty essayist and poet, advocate of the classical writing 古文運動|古文运动 and neoclassical 復古|复古 movements
